area_name: Sun Block aka Southernmost Boulder, The

content.description: Start low on a sloping ledge, move up to better edges and an easy mantle top out.
content.location: Right up the center of the West Face, follow the chalk. The easiest downclimb is via the N.E. Arete.

content.description:
Start sitting on two small edges below the obvious prow (that makes up the left end of a large diagonal shelf). Power up to the prow/shelf, and then move slightly left and up.

This is a quality line.
content.protection: A couple of pads are ideal.
content.location: When approaching from the parking, this is the obvious, short prow that is staring you in the face.

content.description:
Start standing with the left hand on a diagonal edge/sidepull and the right hand on a small crimp gaston, both at around 5 feet. Move straight up the face, avoiding all of the holds on 'Your Climbing Makes My Eyes Bleed'.

Balancey, technical climbing and really quite good.
content.protection: A couple of pads are ideal.
content.location: This is located on the north face of the boulder, to the left of 'Your Climbing Makes...'.

content.description: Start sitting beneath the small roof with the right hand on a small edge and the left hand on a large gaston/flake feature. Move left to the large diagonal shelf, and finish straight up from there. Many variations are possible.
content.protection: A pad or two is ideal.
content.location: This starts underneath the small roof that is easily seen when approaching from the parking.

climbs.name: North Face Right aka Your Climbing Makes My Eyes Bleed

content.description: Sit start just left of the tree. Move up and follow nice crimps to the top.
content.location: On the right side of the North Face, just left of the tree. Easiest down climb is via the N.E. Arete.

pathTokens: Sun Block aka Southernmost Boulder, The
